verses.text: And when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down out of the mount , the people gathered themselves together unto Aaron , and said unto him, Up , make us gods , which shall go before us; for \add as for\add* this Moses , the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt , we wot not what is become of him.
And Aaron said unto them, Break off the golden earrings , which \add are\add* in the ears of your wives , of your sons , and of your daughters , and bring \add them\add* unto me.
And all the people brake off the golden earrings which \add were\add* in their ears , and brought \add them\add* unto Aaron.

And he received \add them\add* at their hand , and fashioned it with a graving tool , after he had made it a molten calf : and they said , These \add be\add* thy gods , O Israel , which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
And when Aaron saw \add it\add*, he built an altar before it; and Aaron made proclamation , and said , To morrow \add is\add* a feast to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And they rose up early on the morrow , and offered burnt offerings , and brought peace offerings ; and the people sat down to eat and to drink , and rose up to play. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Moses , Go , get thee down ; for thy people , which thou broughtest out of the land of Egypt , have corrupted \add themselves:\add*

They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them: they have made them a molten calf , and have worshipped it, and have sacrificed thereunto, and said , These \add be\add* thy gods , O Israel , which have brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Moses , I have seen this people , and, behold, it \add is\add* a stiffnecked people :
Now therefore let me alone , that my wrath may wax hot against them, and that I may consume them: and I will make of thee a great nation.

And Moses besought the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* his God , and said , 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, why doth thy wrath wax hot against thy people , which thou hast brought forth out of the land of Egypt with great power , and with a mighty hand ?  +  r 32.11  t the \+nd LORD\+nd*: Heb. the face of the \+nd LORD\+nd* *

Wherefore should the Egyptians speak , and say , For mischief did he bring them out, to slay them in the mountains , and to consume them from the face of the earth ? Turn from thy fierce wrath , and repent of this evil against thy people.

Remember Abraham , Isaac , and Israel , thy servants , to whom thou swarest by thine own self, and saidst unto them, I will multiply your seed as the stars of heaven , and all this land that I have spoken of will I give unto your seed , and they shall inherit \add it\add* for ever.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* repented of the evil which he thought to do unto his people. \p

¶ And Moses turned , and went down from the mount , and the two tables of the testimony \add were\add* in his hand : the tables \add were\add* written on both their sides ; on the one side and on the other \add were\add* they written.
And the tables \add were\add* the work of God , and the writing \add was\add* the writing of God , graven upon the tables.
And when Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted , he said unto Moses , \add There is\add* a noise of war in the camp.

And he said , \add It is\add* not the voice of \add them that\add* shout for mastery , neither \add is it\add* the voice of \add them that\add* cry for being overcome : \add but\add* the noise of \add them that\add* sing do I hear.\f + \fr 32.18 \ft being…: Heb. weakness\f* \p

¶ And it came to pass, as soon as he came nigh unto the camp , that he saw the calf , and the dancing : and Moses’ anger waxed hot , and he cast the tables out of his hands , and brake them beneath the mount.

And he took the calf which they had made , and burnt \add it\add* in the fire , and ground \add it\add* to powder , and strawed \add it\add* upon the water , and made the children of Israel drink \add of it\add*. \p
And Moses said unto Aaron , What did this people unto thee, that thou hast brought so great a sin upon them?
And Aaron said , Let not the anger of my lord wax hot : thou knowest the people , that they \add are set\add* on mischief.
For they said unto me, Make us gods , which shall go before us: for \add as for\add* this Moses , the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt , we wot not what is become of him.
And I said unto them, Whosoever hath any gold , let them break \add it\add* off. So they gave \add it\add* me: then I cast it into the fire , and there came out this calf. \p

¶ And when Moses saw that the people \add were\add* naked ; (for Aaron had made them naked unto \add their\add* shame among their enemies :)\f + \fr 32.25 \ft their enemies: Heb. those that rose up against them\f*

Then Moses stood in the gate of the camp , and said , Who \add is\add* on the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* side? \add let him come\add* unto me. And all the sons of Levi gathered themselves together unto him.

And he said unto them, Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , Put every man his sword by his side , \add and\add* go in and out from gate to gate throughout the camp , and slay every man his brother , and every man his companion , and every man his neighbour.
And the children of Levi did according to the word of Moses : and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.

For Moses had said , Consecrate yourselves to day to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, even every man upon his son , and upon his brother ; that he may bestow upon you a blessing this day.\f + \fr 32.29 \ft For Moses…: or, And Moses said, Consecrate yourselves to day to the \+nd LORD\+nd*, because every man hath been against his brother, etc\f*\f + \fr 32.29 \ft Consecrate…: Heb. Fill your hands\f* \p

¶ And it came to pass on the morrow , that Moses said unto the people , Ye have sinned a great sin : and now I will go up unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; peradventure I shall make an atonement for your sin.
And Moses returned unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and said , Oh , this people have sinned a great sin , and have made them gods of gold.
Yet now, if thou wilt forgive their sin —; and if not, blot me, I pray thee, out of thy book which thou hast written.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Moses , Whosoever hath sinned against me, him will I blot out of my book.

Therefore now go , lead the people unto \add the place\add* of which I have spoken unto thee: behold, mine Angel shall go before thee: nevertheless in the day when I visit I will visit their sin upon them.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* plagued the people , because they made the calf , which Aaron made.
